    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
        Initialize graph

      • numOfNodes

        int numOfNodes()
        Get the number of nodes (vertices)
        Returns:
        number of nodes in graph

      • numOfEgdes

        int numOfEgdes(int id)
        Get the number of outgoing eges of a node. The number of outgoing edges are same as the number of neighbors
        Parameters:
        id - the id of a node
        Returns:
        the number of edges (neighbors). If there are no neighbours, return -1;

      • addNode

        boolean addNode(int id)
        Add a node in graph
        Parameters:
        id - the id of then ode
        Returns:
        if a node is added, it returns true. if a node is not added because it exists already, it returns false.

      • getNode

        Node getNode(int id)
        Get then ode with id
        Parameters:
        id - id of the node
        Returns:
        the node. If node with the id does not exist, it reutnrs null.

      • addEdge

        boolean addEdge(int fromId,
                int toId)
        Add a directional edge between two nodes
        Parameters:
        fromId - id of the node starting the edge
        toId - id of the node ending the edge
        Returns:
        If an ege is added, it returns true. If an edge is not added with other reasons, it returns false. The reasons can be 1) any node does not exist. 2) the edge already exist

      • removeNode

        boolean removeNode(int id)
        Remove a node from graph It removes all edges of the node.
        Parameters:
        id - id of the node to be removed
        Returns:
        if the node with id is removed correclty, it returns true. OItherwise, it returns false

      • removeEdge

        boolean removeEdge(int fromId,
                   int toId)
        Remove a directional edge between two nodes
        Parameters:
        fromId - id of node starting the edge
        toId - id of node ending the edge
        Returns:
        if edge id removed correctly, it returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.

      • hasEdge

        boolean hasEdge(int fromId,
                int toId)
        Returns true if the directinal edge exists between two nodes
        Parameters:
        fromId - id of node starting the edge
        toId - id of node ending the edge
        Returns:
        if the edge exists between two nodes Otherwise, it returns false

      • neighbors

        java.lang.Integer[] neighbors(int id)
        Returns ids of neighbors
        Parameters:
        id - id of node enngind the edge
        Returns:
        true if the edge exists between two nodes. Otherwise, it returns false.
